comment.author: 10258371@N02
comment._content: Ernst Udet painted LO on the side of his aircraft

comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This is Frank Tallman's Fokker D.VII that has since been sold back to Holland and it has been thoroughly restored and put in postwar Dutch Air Service markings. This aircraft has a Hispano-Suiza installed. YOu can se the nose and radiator modifications w/ the cylinder bank fairings and exhaust stubs. The nose of the Pfalz D.XII can just be seen to the right. It is now restored and in Seattle at the Museum of Flight/Personal Courage Wing.

comment.author: 10258371@N02
comment._content: Thanks, much. There is even a video on YouTube about this aircraft with it's new Mercedes engine: www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gd3CGi-MXfo
